title: Choosing the Seven
shortSummary: Acts Chapter 6 describes the early church's response to internal conflict by appointing seven men to oversee daily ministry needs, allowing the apostles to focus on prayer and the word. This chapter highlights the importance of wise leadership, the power of the Holy Spirit, and introduces Stephen, whose faith and wisdom lead to opposition and his eventual trial.
timeline: c. AD 30-33 - Early Jerusalem Church Growth

keyCharacters.name: Stephen
keyCharacters.description: One of the seven chosen to serve, full of faith and the Holy Ghost, who performs miracles and faces opposition for his bold witness.

keyCharacters.name: The Twelve Apostles
keyCharacters.description: The original apostles who recognize the need to delegate practical ministry tasks to maintain focus on prayer and preaching.

keyCharacters.name: Nicolas
keyCharacters.description: A proselyte of Antioch, one of the seven men chosen for honest report and wisdom to serve the church.

definitions.definition: Greek-speaking Jewish Christians in the early church, often Hellenistic Jews distinct from Hebrew-speaking Jews.
A Gentile convert to Judaism who later became a follower of Christ in the early church.
Complaining or grumbling, often about perceived unfair treatment or neglect.
A Jewish synagogue in Jerusalem composed of freedmen (former slaves) from various regions, including Cyrene and Alexandria.

outline.heading: The Problem of Neglected Widows
outline.description: As the church grows, a complaint arises that Greek-speaking widows are being neglected in daily food distribution, highlighting the need for organized care.

outline.heading: Appointment of Seven Servants
outline.description: The apostles instruct the disciples to choose seven men of good reputation, full of the Holy Spirit and wisdom, to oversee this ministry, ensuring the apostles can focus on prayer and the word.

outline.heading: Growth and Obedience in the Church
outline.description: The ministry of the word flourishes, the number of disciples increases greatly, and many priests become obedient to the faith, demonstrating the power of the Spirit at work.

outline.heading: Stephen’s Opposition and Trial
outline.description: Stephen, full of faith and power, faces opposition from members of various synagogues who falsely accuse him of blasphemy, leading to his arrest and presentation before the council.

application: Serve others faithfully by using your gifts to meet practical needs in the church, supporting the ministry of the word.
Prioritize prayer and the study of Scripture as foundational for effective Christian leadership and service.
Stand firm in faith and wisdom when facing opposition, trusting the Holy Spirit to guide and empower you.
Recognize the importance of godly leadership chosen for integrity and spiritual maturity in the local church.

keyVerses.text: But we will give ourselves continually to prayer, and to the ministry of the word.
keyVerses.significance: This verse emphasizes the apostles’ commitment to spiritual priorities, setting a model for church leadership.

keyVerses.text: And the saying pleased the whole multitude: and they chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Ghost, and Philip, and Prochorus, and Nicanor, and Timon, and Parmenas, and Nicolas a proselyte of Antioch:
keyVerses.significance: This verse introduces the seven chosen men, highlighting the importance of faith and the Holy Spirit in church service.

keyVerses.text: And Stephen, full of faith and power, did great wonders and miracles among the people.
keyVerses.significance: This verse shows the Spirit’s power working through Stephen, validating his ministry and witness.

keyVerses.text: And all that sat in the council, looking stedfastly on him, saw his face as it had been the face of an angel.
keyVerses.significance: This verse reveals the divine presence and approval upon Stephen even in the face of persecution.
